All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AdapterPlayers
The AdapterPlayers abstract class serves as the base implementation for all player types participating in the card game.
Card
Represents a playing card with a symbol, URL, and associated value.
CardPile
Represents a pile of cards with an accumulated value in the game.
Deck
Represents a standard deck of 52 playing cards.
Eliminate
The Eliminate class represents a singleton JavaFX Stage used to display the "eliminate" window within the application.
FinalMessageController
Controller class responsible for managing the final winner dialog displayed at the end of a match.
GameWindow
The GameWindow class represents the main game interface window.
GameWindowController
Main controller class for the game window interface.
InvalidCardException
Exception thrown when a player attempts to play a card that would cause the pile value to exceed the maximum allowed value of 50.
IPlayers
The IPlayers interface defines the fundamental behaviors and actions that any player in the card game must implement.
Main
Entry point of the 'Cincuentazo' JavaFX application.
PlayerGPU
Represents an AI-controlled player (GPU) in the card game.
PlayerHuman
Represents a human-controlled player in the card game.
RechargeDeck
Thread responsible for automatically recharging the deck when it runs empty.
RulesController
Controller responsible for handling interactions within the Rules window.
RulesWindow
Represents the Rules window of the 50zo game.
SelectionPlayers
The SelectionPlayers class represents the player selection window of the Cincuentazo application.
SelectionPlayersController
Controller class for the player selection screen.
ShowWiner
The Messages class represents a modal pop-up window used to display end-of-game results or other important notifications.
StartWindow
The StartWindow class represents the main menu window of the Cincuentazo application.
StartWindowController
Controller class for the main start window of the application.
TakeWiner
The TakeWiner class is a background thread responsible for detecting when only one player remains in the game, indicating the winner.
TurnManager
The TurnManager class manages the sequence of turns for all players in the game.
